title: Freebie and the Bean
description:
A hard-to-find slapstick action movie from the seventies; still holds up pretty good, though it&#039;s far from really great, as you would expect from a bunch of crazy, dynamic masterpieces of that era. Anyway, looking at the movie from this year&#039;s perspective it&#039;s perfectly safe to say that PG-13 Hollywood of today would be almost too progressive with flicks like this one, not to say smart. 

Hope you&#039;ll enjoy it because I certainly did. Years passed looking for this forgotten gem, with no DVD edition - as far as I&#039;m aware - on the Amazon. For that matter, I still don&#039;t have ANY idea on which torrent site I found this Rush&#039;s film. At the same time, don&#039;t worry about quality; if it&#039;s not DVDRip it&#039;s picture-perfect PDTV-rip. (Hope you&#039;re also downloading the streets of san francisco [first two seasons] from this site; another bang-up 70s crime show....)
